item.title: Number of non-farm firms grew 13% to 7.3 crore: Govt survey | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
India's Non-Farm Firms Surge by 13% to 7.3 Crore: Government Survey

Publication Date: New Delhi, October 2023

The number of non-farm firms in India has grown to 7.34 crore, reflecting robust recovery and growth in the unincorporated non-agricultural sector post-pandemic.

  • 12.84% increase in non-farm firms reported for the period October 2023 to September 2024.
  • Manufacturing accounted for over 20% of the gross value added, with trade at one-third and services at 44%.
  • Employment in these enterprises rose to 12 crore, nearly 10% higher than the previous year.
  • Women-owned establishments increased from 23% to 26.2% compared to the previous year.
  • The average wage per worker saw a 13% growth, with manufacturing leading at over 16% increase.
“This wage growth serves as a catalyst, strengthening the labour market, enhancing productivity, and fuelling broader economic demand.” - Ministry of Statistics

The substantial growth in non-farm enterprises indicates a positive trend in India's economic recovery, empowerment of women in entrepreneurship, and improvement in employment conditions.

item.title: Another boost after bumper IPO, listing gains! International Gemmological Institute - Mega Rs 1347.17 cr acquisition - ET Now
item.description:
International Gemmological Institute Acquires Two Companies for Rs 1347.17 Crore

Updated December 24, 2024 | Source: ET Now

The International Gemmological Institute has acquired a 100% stake in IGI Netherlands B.V. and International Gemmological Institute BV for approximately Rs 1347.17 crore, following a successful IPO listing.

  • Acquisition includes IGI Netherlands B.V. and International Gemmological Institute BV as wholly owned subsidiaries.
  • IGI Netherlands B.V. operates in Dubai, Israel, Thailand, Hong Kong, China, and Egypt.
  • International Gemmological Institute BV was established in 1975 and operates in Belgium and the USA.
“...we would like to inform you that the Company has acquired 100% stake in IGI Netherlands B.V. and International Gemmological Institute BV...”

This acquisition marks a significant expansion for International Gemmological Institute, solidifying its global presence in the certification and accreditation services market for diamonds and gemstones.

item.title: Elon Musk's xAI raises $6 billion funding from BlackRock, Nvidia, AMD, and others | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Elon Musk's xAI Secures $6 Billion in Funding from Major Investors

Date: December 23, 2024 | Source: Live Mint

Elon Musk's artificial intelligence company, xAI, successfully raised $6 billion in a Series C funding round from prominent investors, including BlackRock, Nvidia, and AMD, to enhance its AI infrastructure.

  • The funding was announced via xAI's official blog.
  • Series C funding will be used for advancing infrastructure and R&D.
  • This marks the second funding round in 2024, following a similar $6 billion Series B round in May.
  • Key participants in this round include a16z, Fidelity, and Morgan Stanley.
  • Major initiatives from xAI include the launch of Colossus, the world's largest AI supercomputer, and Grok 2, its second language model.
“The funds from this financing round will be used to further accelerate our advanced infrastructure, ship groundbreaking products that will be used by billions of people.” — xAI

Looking to the future, xAI is developing Grok 3 and other innovative products to enhance how individuals and businesses engage with technology.

item.title: India’s growth trajectory to lift in H2FY25 because of resilient domestic private consumption: RBI bulleti - The Economic Times
item.description:
India’s Growth Trajectory to Lift in H2FY25 Due to Resilient Domestic Consumption, Says RBI Bulletin

Publication Date: December 2023 | Source: Reserve Bank of India Bulletin

India’s growth trajectory is set to improve in the second half of 2024-25, primarily fueled by strong domestic private consumption.

Key insights from the RBI bulletin highlight significant factors contributing to India's economic outlook, amid ongoing challenges.

  • India's growth outlook is supported by resilient private consumption demand.
  • Record foodgrains production and momentum in rural demand are key drivers.
  • Sustained government spending on infrastructure is expected to foster growth.
  • The economy grew at its slowest pace in nearly two years, with a GDP growth of 5.4%.
  • Inflation remains a concern, exceeding the RBI’s target of 4%.
  • High prices have slowed demand, but easing food prices offer some relief.
  • Strong festival activity indicates recovering momentum in the economy.
“High frequency indicators for the third quarter indicate that the Indian economy is recovering from the slowdown in Q2.” - RBI Bulletin

The RBI’s analysis suggests that while certain global factors pose risks, there is optimism about a recovery in India's economic performance.

item.title: Why American Airlines grounded all US flights for an hour on busy Christmas Eve - The Times of India
item.description:
Why American Airlines Grounded All US Flights for an Hour on Busy Christmas Eve

Date: December 24, 2023 Source: Times of India

On Christmas Eve, American Airlines caused a disruption in air travel by grounding all its flights across the United States for over an hour due to operational issues, impacting numerous travelers during one of the busiest travel days of the year.

  • The grounding occurred for about one hour, creating significant delays.
  • The disruption affected thousands of passengers and thousands of flights nationwide.
  • The decision was made to ensure safety and operational efficiency.
“Safety is our top priority, and we made this decision to ensure that all operations are secure and reliable during peak travel times,” said an airline spokesperson.

This incident highlights the challenges and responsibilities airlines face during high-demand periods, emphasizing the importance of operational integrity and passenger safety.

item.title: BPCL begins Rs 6,100 cr pre-project activities on Andhra refinery - Business Standard
item.description:
BPCL begins Rs 6,100 cr pre-project activities on Andhra refinery

Publication Date: [Date not provided] Source: [Source not provided]

Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited (BPCL) has announced the start of pre-project activities for a greenfield refinery-cum-petrochemical complex in Andhra Pradesh, valued at Rs 6,100 crore. The company also secured NTPC’s reverse auction for solar projects.

Key Points

  • Approval for greenfield refinery-cum-petrochemical complex.
  • The project cost is Rs 6,100 crore.
  • Activities include land acquisition and environmental assessments.
  • BPCL won a solar project for 1,200 MW ISTS-connected capacity, emerging as the lowest bidder for 150 MW.
  • The solar project has a budget of Rs 756.45 crore and projected annual revenue of Rs 100 crore.
“This milestone highlights BPCL's commitment to advancing renewable energy initiatives and contributing to India’s clean energy transition.”

BPCL's shares rose by 0.9% following these announcements.

item.title: American Airlines, World's Largest, Grounds All US Flights On Christmas Eve - NDTV
item.description:
American Airlines Grounds All US Flights on Christmas Eve Due to Technical Glitch

Date: December 24, 2024 Source: Reuters

On Christmas Eve, American Airlines, the world's largest airline carrier, grounded all its flights in the United States due to a technical glitch. This disruption occurs during one of the busiest travel times of the year.

  • American Airlines faced a technical glitch leading to the grounding of all US flights.
  • The airline informed passengers of the situation and promised updates every 15 minutes.
  • Many passengers expressed frustration on social media about the cancellations and inconveniences.
  • Shares of American Airlines fell by 3.8% before market opening.
  • This incident follows a notable Microsoft outage that impacted various industries globally.
“Our teams are working to resolve the issue as quickly as possible, and we apologize to our customers for the inconvenience.” - American Airlines

This incident highlights the vulnerabilities in airline operations during peak travel seasons, raising questions about the reliability of technological systems in critical infrastructure.

item.title: Medical devices maker Poly Medicure to focus on exports amid geopolitical shift | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Medical devices maker Poly Medicure to focus on exports amid geopolitical shift

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Mint

Indian medical equipment manufacturer Poly Medicure Ltd. is increasing its focus on export markets due to growing demand in the US and a global movement to diversify supply chains away from China.

  • Poly Medicure is responding to a global narrative of shifting technology from China.
  • The company has acknowledged significant demand in the US market.
  • Himanshu Baid, managing director, emphasizes the need for a bold approach in light of these shifts.
“The narrative is very clear globally, that people want to move technology away from China...” - Himanshu Baid

The strategic shift towards exports may help Poly Medicure align with changing international market dynamics while addressing increasing demands.

item.title: Motilal Oswal’s top 10 stock picks for 2025 - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Motilal Oswal’s Top 10 Stock Picks for 2025

Date: October 12, 2023 | Source: CNBC TV18

Motilal Oswal has outlined its top 10 stock picks for 2025 across multiple sectors, including IT, healthcare, BFSI, and real estate, with potential upsides based on robust growth prospects.

  • ICICI Bank: Target price of ₹1,550 (19.4% upside)
  • HCL Technologies: Target price of ₹2,300 (21.6% upside)
  • Larsen & Toubro: Target price of ₹4,300 (18.3% upside)
  • Zomato: Target price of ₹330 (20.2% upside)
  • NAM India: Target price of ₹900 (19.6% upside)
  • Mankind Pharma: Target price of ₹3,140 (8% upside)
  • Lemon Tree Hotels: Target price of ₹190 (25.5% upside)
  • Polycab India: Target price of ₹8,340 (17.8% upside)
  • Macrotech Developers: Target price of ₹1,770 (26.7% upside)
  • Syrma SGS Technology: Target price of ₹750 (25.2% upside)
"These stocks are poised to deliver robust returns, making them top investment opportunities for the year ahead." - Motilal Oswal

In conclusion, these selected stocks are identified as potential winners for 2025, reflecting strong market positions and anticipated growth.

item.title: Ventive Hospitality IPO subscribed 9.80 times on Day 3; Check latest GMP, subscription status, other details | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Ventive Hospitality IPO Subscribed 9.80 Times on Day 3

Publication Date: December 24, 2023 Source: Live Mint

Luxury hospitality business developer Ventive Hospitality's initial public offering (IPO) received a strong response, closing at 9.80 times subscription on the final day.

Key Points:

  • The IPO aimed to raise ₹1,600 crore by offering 2.49 crore equity shares.
  • Non-Institutional Investors subscribed 13.85 times, while Qualified Institutional Buyers came in at 9.08 times.
  • The grey market premium (GMP) is currently ₹56 per share, indicating expected listing at ₹699.
  • The funds will be used to pay off borrowings and for general corporate purposes.
“The IPO raised ₹719.5 crore from anchor investors ahead of the public issue.”

Conclusion: The strong subscription rates indicate robust investor interest in Ventive Hospitality, with its shares expected to list on December 30.

item.title: Unimech Aerospace IPO Day 2 Live Updates: Issue was subscribed 9.09x on the second day; Check GMP, subscription | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Unimech Aerospace IPO Day 2 Live Updates: Issue was subscribed 9.09x on the second day; Check GMP, subscription

Date: 24 Dec, 2024
Source: Live Mint

The Unimech Aerospace IPO has seen tremendous interest as it enters its second day of bidding. The price band has been set between ₹745-785 per share, with a public offer totaling ₹500 crore.

  • The IPO was subscribed 9.09x on the second day.
  • Non-Institutional Investors portion subscribed 12.07x.
  • Retail investors portion subscribed 10.30x.
  • The grey market premium (GMP) stands at ₹510.
  • Expected listing price of shares approximately ₹1,295, reflecting a premium of 64.97%.
The public issue of Unimech Aerospace was subscribed for 4,27,66,226 shares against the 47,04,028 shares available.

The overwhelming response signifies strong investor confidence in Unimech's business model and growth trajectory.

item.title: Justin Sun wants to be the Musk of crypto - Mint
item.description:
Justin Sun Wants to Be the Musk of Crypto

Publication Date: Not specified   Source: Company Business News

Justin Sun, founder of the Tron blockchain, has become prominent in the cryptocurrency market, aligning with President-elect Donald Trump.

  • Invested $30 million in Trump-backed crypto project, World Liberty Financial.
  • His investment came amid struggles for the project to meet fundraising targets.
  • Sun serves as an adviser, ensuring potential payouts for the Trump family.
“President-elect Donald Trump’s newest ally in the cryptocurrency markets is a Chinese-born entrepreneur who has been accused of fraud by U.S. regulators and recently spent $6.2 million on a banana.”

This article discusses Sun's financial commitment and potential influence in the cryptocurrency landscape as he aims to establish himself as a key player in the industry.

item.title: Only One Bag, Not More Than 7kg: New Rules For Hand Luggage On Flights - News18
item.description:
Only One Bag, Not More Than 7kg: New Rules For Hand Luggage On Flights

Date: December 24, 2024

Source: News18

If traveling by air, passengers should know the new hand baggage policy by the Bureau of Civil Aviation Security (BCAS) to avoid complications.

  • Passengers are allowed only one hand or cabin bag on board.
  • Hand baggage must not exceed 7 kg for economy class; 10 kg for first/business class.
  • Bag dimensions must not exceed 55 cm x 40 cm x 20 cm.
  • Exemption for tickets booked before May 2, 2024: up to 12 kg for business class.
  • Indigo Airlines also allows one cabin bag with a personal item not exceeding 3 kg.
“Being unaware of these rules could lead to avoidable complications upon arrival.”

The new regulations emphasize the need for travelers to adapt to changing airline policies to ensure a smoother travel experience.

item.title: Top Gainers and Losers today on 24 December, 2024: Tata Motors, Adani Enterprises, Power Grid Corporation Of India, JSW Steel among most active stocks; Check full list here | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Top Gainers and Losers today on 24 December, 2024

Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: Live Mint

The latest trading session revealed a slight decline in the Nifty index, which closed at 23,753.45. The Sensex also experienced a decrease, concluding at 78,540.17. Key performers included Tata Motors and Adani Enterprises as top gainers, while Power Grid Corporation and JSW Steel were among the highest losers.

Nifty Index Top Gainers and Losers Today

  • Top Gainers: Tata Motors (up 1.92%), Adani Enterprises (up 1.43%), Bharat Petroleum (up 1.00%), ITC (up 0.89%), Eicher Motors (up 0.89%)
  • Top Losers: Power Grid Corporation (down 1.65%), JSW Steel (down 1.62%), SBI Life Insurance (down 1.30%), Titan Company (down 1.28%), State Bank of India (down 1.11%)

Market Overview

The Nifty Midcap 50 index dropped by 0.18%, while the Nifty Small Cap 100 gained modestly. Notable statistics from recent weeks and months highlight the varying performance in different sectors and indices.

Conclusion

The stock market is showing mixed trends with certain sectors experiencing gains while others face declines. Investors are advised to keep a close watch on market movements.

item.title: Stock market holiday: Will BSE, NSE be shut for trading tomorrow on account of Christmas? | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Stock Market Holiday: BSE and NSE Closed for Christmas

Date: December 25, 2024
Source: Live Mint

The BSE and NSE will remain closed on December 25, 2024, for trading activities due to Christmas. This closure marks the last holiday of the year for the domestic stock exchanges.

  • The stock market will be closed for trading including currency derivatives, commodity derivatives, and electronic gold receipts.
  • The BSE and NSE observed 16 holidays in 2024, starting with January 26.
  • This week will only have four trading days due to the holiday.
  • Experts expect market volatility in the first half of 2025, with potential recovery as corporate earnings improve.
"The durability of growth, revival of corporate earnings, government policies and global factors...will be key factors that will dictate the market trends in 2025."

Overall, the stock market's future outlook hinges on various economic factors, and traders are advised to consult experts before making investment decisions.

item.title: Big day today! Transrail Lighting IPO allotment status online - Will you get shares? - ET Now
item.description:
Big day today! Transrail Lighting IPO allotment status online - Will you get shares?

Updated Dec 24, 2024 15:25 IST | Source: ET NOW

The Transrail Lighting IPO allotment status is expected to be finalized today and will be available online on the registrar's website and BSE website.

  • The IPO was subscribed 80.80 times with a total bid for 1,12,44,40,452 shares against 1,39,16,742 shares on offer.
  • The non-institutional investors' quota was subscribed 76.41 times, and the retail portion was subscribed 22.07 times.
  • The qualified institutional buyers (QIBs) portion received an outstanding subscription rate of 201.06 times.

The allotment can be checked by entering the PAN number on the registrar's website. The shares are set to list on NSE and BSE on December 27, 2024, starting at 10 AM.

"Transrail Lighting shares are trading at a premium of around Rs 192, indicating a grey market premium of approximately 44%."

It is essential for potential investors to consult their financial advisors before making investment decisions.

item.description:
Unimech Aerospace IPO Day 2 Live Updates: Issue booked 8.19x, NII portion leads with 9.99x; Check GMP, subscription

Date: 24 Dec 2024

Source: Live Mint

The IPO for Unimech Aerospace has seen a robust response on its second day, with a total subscription of 8.19x, led by the non-institutional investor segment.

  • The IPO price band is set at ₹745-785 per share.
  • The total issue size is ₹500 crore, comprising a fresh issue and an offer for sale.
  • The grey market premium (GMP) has risen to ₹510 per share.
  • The shares are expected to list at a premium of 64.97% compared to the upper price band.
“The Unimech Aerospace IPO has received overwhelming interest from various investor segments.”

This IPO concludes on December 26, 2024, and is positioned as a significant opportunity for investors in the engineering sector.

item.title: After rupee hits record low, Juhi Chawla's shocking post resurfaces, internet reacts hilariously: 'Thank God - Indiatimes.com
item.description:
Juhi Chawla's Hilarious Comments Resurfaces as Rupee Hits Record Low

Date: December 24, 2024 Source: Indiatimes

The rupee has fallen to a record low of 85.16 against the US dollar, prompting a surge of memes and a resurgence of an older tweet from actress Juhi Chawla, which has drawn amusing reactions online.

  • The rupee dipped 5 paise to reach 85.16, impacted by a stronger dollar and foreign capital outflows.
  • Juhi Chawla's 2013 tweet about the rupee's decline unexpectedly resurfaced, with her saying, 'Thank God, Apun ke underwear ka naam 'Dollar' hai.'
  • The tweet sparked laughter online, especially as the rupee continues to struggle.
“Thank God my underwear is Dollar. If it were a rupee, it would keep falling again and again.” - Juhi Chawla

With the rupee falling rapidly in recent months, this latest decline highlights broader economic issues facing India, as growth slows and capital inflows dwindle.
